meanings.sent1: She forewarns her friends about the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast forewarns of heavy rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat forewarns the birds by chirping loudly.
meanings.sent4: The old clock forewarns of the passing hours with its loud chimes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher forewarns the students of the pop quiz next week.

meanings.definition: To give advance notice or warning.
meanings.sent1: He always forewarns his family before arriving home.
meanings.sent2: The signs forewarn drivers of the sharp curve ahead.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog forewarns the mailman of his approach.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds forewarn of an impending thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The alarm system forewarns the homeowners of any intruders.
